channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Two years after Dobbs; militants attack in southern Russia
item.description: Deadly attacks reported in Russia's southern republic of Dagestan. Abortions are up two years since the Supreme Court revoked federal abortion protections.
item.content:encoded:
Deadly attacks reported in Russia's southern republic of Dagestan. Abortions are up two years since the Supreme Court revoked federal abortion protections.

(Image credit: DREW ANGERER/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Majd Al-Waheidi

item.title: Biden and Trump are about to debate one another for the first time in 4 years
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with former presidential speechwriters Mary Kate Cary and Paul Orzulak about Thursday's debate between President Biden and his predecessor Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with former presidential speechwriters Mary Kate Cary and Paul Orzulak about Thursday's debate between President Biden and his predecessor Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: There's been a breakthrough in organ transplants
item.description: Surgeons at Northwestern Medicine say they successfully transplanted a kidney while the patient was awake.
item.content:encoded: Surgeons at Northwestern Medicine say they successfully transplanted a kidney while the patient was awake.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Biden and Trump will debate on Thursday. Hereâ€™s what you need to know
item.description: President Biden and former President Donald Trump will face off in the first presidential debate of the 2024 general election on Thursday night in Atlanta. Find out how to watch and what to watch for.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden and former President Donald Trump will face off in the first presidential debate of the 2024 general election on Thursday night in Atlanta. Find out how to watch and what to watch for.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images; Carlos Osorio/AP)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: U.S. is 'flying blind' with bird flu, repeating mistakes of COVID, health experts say
item.description: Three months into the U.S. bird flu outbreak, only 45 people have been tested and clinical labs aren't approved to detect the virus. They complain of slowness and uncertainty from the CDC and FDA.
item.content:encoded:
Three months into the U.S. bird flu outbreak, only 45 people have been tested and clinical labs aren't approved to detect the virus. They complain of slowness and uncertainty from the CDC and FDA.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell/AP)
item.dc:creator: Amy Maxmen

item.title: Israel talks of winding down its most intense fighting in Gaza
item.description: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant is in Washington this week, and will continue conversations while Israel fights on two fronts -- in Gaza and on the border with Lebanon.
item.content:encoded: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant is in Washington this week, and will continue conversations while Israel fights on two fronts -- in Gaza and on the border with Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Inside the Chinese-funded and staffed marijuana farms springing up across the U.S.
item.description: Large numbers of migrants from China are crossing into the U.S. and finding work on marijuana farms. Some of the businesses are accused of exploiting workers and violating state growing rules.
item.content:encoded: Large numbers of migrants from China are crossing into the U.S. and finding work on marijuana farms. Some of the businesses are accused of exploiting workers and violating state growing rules.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Gabrielle Rose won't swim in the Olympics. The 46-year-old wanted something bigger
item.description: At age 46, Gabrielle Rose knew the Paris Olympics were out of reach. But the swimmer still went head-to-head with athletes half her age at the USA Swimming Olympic trials in Indianapolis.
item.content:encoded:
At age 46, Gabrielle Rose knew the Paris Olympics were out of reach. But the swimmer still went head-to-head with athletes half her age at the USA Swimming Olympic trials in Indianapolis.

(Image credit: Michael Conroy)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: More Americans are living longer. Hereâ€™s a place that helps people thrive
item.description: A center started by Wallis Annenberg in the Koreatown neighborhood of Los Angeles is creating a sense of community for older people who aim to keep learning and growing as they age.
item.content:encoded:
A center started by Wallis Annenberg in the Koreatown neighborhood of Los Angeles is creating a sense of community for older people who aim to keep learning and growing as they age.

(Image credit: Allison Aubrey)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Gunmen killed more than a dozen people in an attack in southern Russia
item.description: Gunmen attacked several religious sites in the region of Dagestan.Â A majority Muslim area, it is home to a diverse group of ethnicities and religious faiths, but no stranger to Islamic extremism.
item.content:encoded: Gunmen attacked several religious sites in the region of Dagestan.Â A majority Muslim area, it is home to a diverse group of ethnicities and religious faiths, but no stranger to Islamic extremism.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes
